Chinese Minister of National Defence to Visit DPRK
articles.content:
Chinese Minister of National Defence to Visit DPRK 
    Pyongyang, April 2 (KCNA) -- Colonel General Cao Gangchuan, member of the Political Bureau of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of China, vice-chairman of the Central Military Commission of the CPC, state councilor and minister of National Defence of China, will soon visit the Democratic People's Republic of Korea.

articles.title: GNP's Anti-DPRK Smear Campaign Denounced
articles.content:
GNP's Anti-DPRK Smear Campaign Denounced 
    Pyongyang, April 2 (KCNA) -- The south Korean Federation of University Student Councils released a statement on March 28 accused Song Yong Son, "national assemblyman" from the "Grand National Party", of talking nonsense during his visit to a foreign country on March 23 that "any assistance to the north would only result in bolstering up the north's military power". The statement asked this politician to which nation he belongs and for whom he works.
 History and the nation will never pardon the sycophantic and treacherous crimes of the GNP, the statement warned, noting that the GNP will never escape a severe punishment by history and the nation in the era of "By our nation itself" for being hell-bent on the anachronistic anti-north smear campaign pursuant to the U.S. policy.

articles.title: Action Group for Reunification Formed in S. Korea
articles.content:
Action Group for Reunification Formed in S. Korea 
    Pyongyang, April 2 (KCNA) -- The Federation of south Korean Trade Unions reportedly had a general meeting and a ceremony in Seoul on Mar. 25 to inaugurate an action group for reunification.
 The general meeting adopted a programme and statute of the group and made public a plan for its activities in 2006 before electing its head and executive chairpersons.
 The group clarified that it would let each region and organization conduct information service and the movement for peace against war for the purpose of implementing the June 15 joint declaration and invigorating the movement for reunification.

All Koreans Called upon to Keep to Road of Songun
articles.content:
All Koreans Called upon to Keep to Road of Songun 
    Pyongyang, April 2 (KCNA) -- The road of Songun followed by the DPRK is the road of justice and truth, says Rodong Sinmun Sunday in a signed article.
 It goes on:  
The road of Songun is one of justice and truth because the Songun politics calls for considering military affairs as the most important ones of the state and remarkably augmenting the national power with main emphasis on the military power, thereby making it possible to defend independence of the popular masses and accelerate the independent development of the country.    
 The Songun politics of the Workers' Party of Korea serves as an invincible weapon for reliably defending the sovereignty of the country and the dignity of the nation.
 Thanks to the invincible armed forces which have grown incomparably stronger than ever before under the banner of Songun the DPRK has fully exercised its sovereignty in all fields of state activities under so hard and complicated situation as today. The DPRK is fully demonstrating its sovereignty and dignity in the fierce political and economic stand-off with the U.S. imperialists as they are backed by the invincible armed forces. 
 The history of the struggle waged by the army and people of the DPRK to defend socialism from the moves of the U.S. imperialists against it goes to prove that the road of Songun alone leads to defending the human cause of independence.

articles.title: Greetings to Guinean President
articles.content:
Greetings to Guinean President 
    Pyongyang, April 2 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, on April 1 sent a message of greetings to Lansana Conte, president of Guinea, on the occasion of the 22nd anniversary of the proclamation of the second republic in Guinea
 The message sincerely wished the president great success in his work for the peace of the country, national unity and socio- economic progress, expressing the belief that the good friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would continue to grow stronger in the future, too.

New School Year Begins in Korea
articles.content:
New School Year Begins in Korea
    Pyongyang, April 1 (KCNA) -- A new school year has begun at schools at all levels across the DPRK.
 Ceremonies of marking the year took place at Kim Song Ju Primary School, Pyongyang Primary School No.4, Kim Jong Suk Middle School No.1, Changdok School, Samhung Middle School, Mubong Middle School in Samjiyon County, Hero Sukchon Middle School No.1 and all other schools across the country on Saturday.
 At the ceremonies, reporters and speakers recalled that President Kim Il Sung established the best socialist educational system, regarding education as an important matter decisive of the victory of the revolution and the destiny of the nation long ago, and showed warm loving care for the younger generations.    
 They noted that leader Kim Jong Il, though he was busy leading the Songun revolution, gave field guidance to universities and other schools, thus energetically  guiding them to develop the educational work as required by the new century.
 Officials in different parts of the country and schools at all levels have provided better conditions and environment for education on the occasion of the new school year.
 Similar ceremonies were held at Kim Il Sung University, Kim Chaek University of Technology, Pyongyang College of Handicrafts and the Daily Necessities Industry and other universities and colleges.    
 The ceremonies were followed by first classes in the new school year.
